Class FlyingBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.board.FlyingBoard
Direct Known Subclasses:
Level1FlyingBoard, Level2FlyingBoard
public abstract class FlyingBoard extends Object
Abstract class representing a FlyingBoard that keeps track of players and their positions.

  • Field Details

    • runLenght

      protected int runLenght
      The `runLenght` variable defines the threshold distance or difference between player positions in the ranking, beyond which a player is considered "doubled" and removed from active competition. It is used as a key parameter in methods that determine player status, such as identifying and handling outplayers based on the position difference from the highest-ranked player. This value is initialized during object construction and plays a role in managing the player ranking and game flow.

    • ranking

      protected final Map<Player,Integer> ranking
      A mapping of players to their respective ranks or scores in the game. This structure is used to track the current standing of all active players based on their performance or position. Each player is associated with an integer value representing their rank or score. The ranking map is updated as the game progresses and is used to determine various gameplay outcomes, such as identifying players who are out of the game or determining the current order of players. This field is immutable to ensure that the reference to the map cannot be changed after initialization, although the contents of the map itself can be modified.

    • gameClientNotifier

      protected GameClientNotifier gameClientNotifier
      The gameClientNotifier is a protected field within the FlyingBoard class. It serves as a communication handler for notifying game clients about various game events, such as player actions, disconnections, or other updates during the game lifecycle. The GameClientNotifier utilizes a combination of asynchronous operations and timeout mechanisms to ensure efficient, non-blocking notifications to all clients, even in cases where some clients are unresponsive or slow to respond. This field is essential for maintaining synchronized communication across clients and updating their state according to the server's state changes during gameplay.

  • Constructor Details

    • FlyingBoard

      public FlyingBoard(int runLength)
      Constructor to initialize runLength, outPlayers, and ranking.
      Parameters:
      runLength - The length difference after which a player is considered doubled.

  • Method Details

    • setGameClientNotifier

      public void setGameClientNotifier(GameClientNotifier gameClientNotifier)
      Sets the GameClientNotifier instance for this class. This notifier is used to manage and notify game clients about game events, such as player actions, disconnections, or other updates.
      Parameters:
      gameClientNotifier - An instance of GameClientNotifier used to handle communication with game clients.

    • insertPlayer

      public abstract int insertPlayer(Player player)
      Inserts a player into the ranking with a specified position.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to be inserted.

    • getPlayerPosition

      public int getPlayerPosition(Player player)
      Retrieves the current position of the specified player in the ranking.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose position is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The integer position of the given player.

    • getOutPlayers

      public Set<Player> getOutPlayers()
      Returns the set of players who have been doubled.
      Returns:
      A set of players who are out of the gameModel.

    • getRanking

      public Map<Player,Integer> getRanking()
      Retrieves the current ranking of players. The ranking is represented as a mapping between players and their corresponding integer positions or scores. The players are mapped to their rank values in the game.
      Returns:
      A Map<Player, Integer> where Player represents a player entity and Integer represents the player's position or score in the ranking.

    • addOutPlayer

      public void addOutPlayer(Player player, boolean isLandingVoluntarily)
      Adds a player to the outPlayers set and removes them from the ranking.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to be marked as out.

    • getDoubledPlayers

      public void getDoubledPlayers()
      Identifies and removes players from the ranking whose position difference from the top-ranked player exceeds the predefined run length. These players are added to the `outPlayers` set.

      The method performs the following: 1. Determines the maximum position in the ranking. 2. Filters players whose position difference from the maximum position is greater than the `runLenght`. 3. Adds the filtered players to the `outPlayers` set. 4. Removes the filtered players from the ranking map.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(Player player, int offset)
      Moves a player by a specified offset, ensuring the new position is not already occupied. This method is synchronized to prevent race conditions when multiple threads attempt to move players simultaneously.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to be moved.
      offset - The number of positions to move (can be positive or negative).

    • getCurrentRanking

      public List<Player> getCurrentRanking()
      Returns the current ranking of players sorted in descending order based on their positions.
      Returns:
      A list of players sorted from highest to lowest position.

    • getCreditsForPosition

      public abstract int getCreditsForPosition(Player player)
      Calculates and retrieves the credits assigned to a player based on their position or rank on the board. This method determines the appropriate credit allocation for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose credits are to be determined based on their position.
      Returns:
      The number of credits assigned to the given player.

    • getPrettiestShipReward

      public abstract int getPrettiestShipReward()
      Retrieves the reward associated with the prettiest ship in the game. This method determines and returns an integer value representing the reward, which may be used in the game dynamics for incentives or ranking purposes.
      Returns:
      An integer value representing the reward for the prettiest ship.
